intro: Anthocleista keniensis, commonly known as Kenyan arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
